detaileddescription.para: no event enabled
detection of rising edge generates the event
detection of falling edge generates the event
detection of either edges generates the event
Defines trigger edge for the event generation by ETLx (Event Trigger Logic, x = [0 to 3]) unit, by getting the signal from ERSx(Event request source, x = [0 to 3]) unit.
input A0 is selected
input A1 is selected
input A2 is selected
input A3 is selected
Defines input signal for path A of ERSx(Event request source, x = [0 to 3]) unit. ETLx Input A selection
input B0 is selected
input B1 is selected
input B2 is selected
input B3 is selected
Defines input signal for path B of ERSx(Event request source, x = [0 to 3]) unit. ETLx Input B selection
Event from input ETLx triggers output OGU0
Event from input ETLx triggers output OGU1
Event from input ETLx triggers output OGU2
Event from input ETLx triggers output OGU3

Defines Output Channel of OGUy(Output gating unit y = [0 to 3]) to be mapped by the trigger pulse generated by ETLx(Event Trigger Logic, x = [0 to 3]) unit.
Generation of output trigger pulse need to be enabled XMC_ERU_OGU_PERIPHERAL_TRIGGER_t ERU_ETL ERU_OGU Connection matrix
trigger pulse generation disabled
trigger pulse generation enabled
Defines generation of the trigger pulse by ETLx(Event Trigger Logic, x = [0 to 3]) unit. Use type XMC_ERU_ETL_OUTPUT_TRIGGER_t for this enum.
select (A) path as a event source
select (B) path as a event source
select (A OR B) path as a event source
select (A AND B) path as a event source
select (inverted A) path as a event source
select (inverted A OR B) path as a event source
select (inverted A AND B) path as a event source
select (inverted B) path as a event source
select (A OR inverted B) path as a event source
select (A AND inverted B) path as a event source
select (inverted A OR inverted B) path as a event source
select (inverted A AND inverted B) path as a event source
Defines input path combination along with polarity for event generation by ERSx(Event request source) unit to ETLx(Event trigger logic),x = [0 to 3] unit. ETLx input trigger signal generation
Status flag is in sticky mode. Retain the same state until cleared by software. In case of pattern match this mode is used.
Status flag is in non-sticky mode. Automatically cleared by the opposite edge detection. eg. if positive edge is selected as trigger event, for the negative edge event the status flag is cleared.
Defines status flag reset mode generated by ETLx(Event Trigger Logic, x = [0 to 3]) unit. Use type XMC_ERU_ETL_STATUS_FLAG_MODE_t for this enum.
Status flag ETL0, participating in pattern match
Status flag ETL1, participating in pattern match
Status flag ETL0, participating in pattern match
Status flag ETL0, participating in pattern match
Defines the inputs for Pattern detection. The configured status flag signal from the ETLx(Event Trigger Logic, x = [0 to 3]) unit indicates the pattern to be detected.
Pattern match is disabled
Pattern match is enabled, the selected status flags of ETLx(Event Trigger Logic, x = [0 to 3]) unit, are used in pattern detection.
Defines pattern detection feature to be enabled or not in OGUy(Output gating unit, y = [0 to 3]).
OGUy1 signal is mapped for event generation
OGUy2 signal is mapped for event generation
OGUy3 signal is mapped for event generation
Defines peripheral trigger signal for event generation. Based on the selected peripheral for event generation, the trigger signal is mapped.
Service request blocked, ERUx_GOUTy = 0
Service request generated enabled, ERUx_GOUTy = 1
Service request generated on trigger event and input pattern match, ERUx_GOUTy = ~pattern matching result
Service request generated on trigger event and input pattern mismatch, ERUx_GOUTy = pattern matching result

Defines the gating scheme for service request generation. In later stage of the OGUy(Output gating unit, y = [0 to 3]) based on the gating scheme selected ERU_GOUTy(gated output signal) output is defined. Interrupt gating signal

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_Disable

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Abstract API, not mandatory to call.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_Enable

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Abstract API, not mandatory to call.

This API is called by XMC_ERU_ETL_Init() or XMC_ERU_OGU_Init() and therefore no need to call it explicitly during initialization sequence. Call this API to enable ERU1 module once again if the module is disabled by calling XMC_ERU_Disable(). For ERU0 module clock gating and reset features are not available.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_ERU_ETL_Init(), XMC_ERU_OGU_Init(), XMC_ERU_Disable().

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_ClearStatusFlag

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3]

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Set the status flag bit(FL) in EXICONx(x = [0 to 3]).
If auto clear of the status flag is not enabled by detection of the opposite edge of the event edge, this API clears the Flag. SO that next event is considered as new event.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_ERU_ETL_SetStatusFlag(), XMC_ERU_ETL_GetStatusFlag()

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_DisableOutputTrigger

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3].

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Disables the trigger pulse generation by clearing the (PE) of the EXICONx(x = channel).
Typically this can used when only pattern match is being used for event generation.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel, const XMC_ERU_ETL_OUTPUT_TRIGGER_CHANNEL_t trigger)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_EnableOutputTrigger

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3].
Output Channel of OGUy(Output gating unit y = [0 to 3]) to be mapped by the trigger pulse Refer XMC_ERU_ETL_OUTPUT_TRIGGER_CHANNEL_t for valid value.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configure which Channel of OGUy(Output gating unit y = [0 to 3]) to be mapped by the trigger pulse generated by ETLx(Event Trigger Logic, x = channel) by setting (OCS and PE) bit fields.

The trigger pulse is generated for one clock pulse along with the flag status update. This is typically used to trigger the ISR for the external events. The configured OGUy(Output gating unit y = [0 to 3]), generates the event based on the trigger pulse.If output trigger pulse generation is disabled by XMC_ERU_ETL_DisableOutputTrigger(), XMC_ERU_ETL_EnableOutputTrigger() can called to reconfigure. These values are set during initialization in XMC_ERU_ETL_Init(). Call this to change the trigger edge, as needed later in the program.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_GetEdgeDetection

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3]

simplesect.para: XMC_ERU_ETL_EDGE_DETECTION_t indicate which egde/s is configured for event generation

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Return event trigger edge/s by reading (RE, FE) bits of EXICONx(x = [0 to 3]) register.
Rising edge, falling edge or either edges can be selected to generate the event. Call this to get the configured trigger edge.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_GetStatusFlag

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3].

simplesect.para: uint32_t Current state of the status flag bit(FL). Result is in 32-bit format.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Returns status flag state of channel.
The function can typically be used to clear the status flag using software, when auto clear is not enabled.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_ERU_ETL_SetStatusFlag(), XMC_ERU_ETL_ClearStatusFlag()

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel, const XMC_ERU_ETL_CONFIG_t *const config)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_Init

detaileddescription.para:
eru
A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address
channel
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel Range : [0 to 3]
config
pointer to a constant ERU_ETLx configuration data structure. Refer data structure XMC_ERU_ETL_CONFIG_t for detail.
None
Description: Initializes the selected ERU_ETLx channel with the config structure.

Invokes XMC_ERU_Enable() to enable eru module clock. Then configures
Input signal for path A and Path B,
Trigger pulse generation,
status flag clear mode,
Event Trigger edge,
Output Channel of OGUy(Output gating unit y = [0 to 3]) to be mapped by the trigger pulse,
input path combination along with polarity for event generation
.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel, const XMC_ERU_ETL_EDGE_DETECTION_t edge_detection)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_SetEdgeDetection

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3]
event trigger edge. Refer XMC_ERU_ETL_EDGE_DETECTION_t enum for valid values.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configure event trigger edge/s by setting (RE, FE) bits of EXICONx(x = [0 to 3]) register.

Rising edge, falling edge or either edges can be selected to generate the event.These values are set during initialization in XMC_ERU_ETL_Init(). Call this to change the trigger edge, as needed later in the program.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel, const XMC_ERU_ETL_INPUT_A_t input_a, const XMC_ERU_ETL_INPUT_B_t input_b)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_SetInput

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3]

input signal for path A of ERSx(Event request source, x = [0 to 3]) unit. Refer XMC_ERU_ETL_INPUT_A_t for valid value or xmc1_eru_map.h/xmc4_eru_map.h file where the mapping of the input is done based on selected signal. e.g: ERU0_ETL3_INPUTA_P2_7.

input signal for path B of ERSx(Event request source, x = [0 to 3]) unit. Refer XMC_ERU_ETL_INPUT_B_t for valid value or xmc1_eru_map.h/xmc4_eru_map.h file where the mapping of the input is done based on selected signal. e.g: ERU0_ETL0_INPUTB_P2_0.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures the event source for path A and path B in with selected input_a and input_b respectively.

These values are set during initialization in XMC_ERU_ETL_Init(). Call this to change the input, as needed later in the program. According to the ports/peripheral selected, the event source has to be changed.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel, const XMC_ERU_ETL_SOURCE_t source)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_SetSource

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3]
input path combination along with polarity for event generation by ERSx(Event request source) unit. Refer XMC_ERU_ETL_SOURCE_t enum for valid input values.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Select input path combination along with polarity for event generation by setting (SS, NA, NB) bits in ERSx(Event request source) unit

The signal ERSxO is generated from the selection and this is connected to ETLx(Event trigger logic, x = [0 to 3]) for further action. These values are set during initialization in XMC_ERU_ETL_Init(). Call this to change the source, as needed later in the program.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_SetStatusFlag

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3]

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Set the status flag bit(FL) in EXICONx(x = [0 to 3]).
The status flag indicates that the configured event has occurred. This status flag is used in Pattern match detection by OGUy(Output gating unit, y = [0 to 3]).

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_ERU_ETL_ClearStatusFlag(), XMC_ERU_ETL_GetStatusFlag()

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel, const XMC_ERU_ETL_STATUS_FLAG_MODE_t mode)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_ETL_SetStatusFlagMode

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address.
ERU_ETLx(Event trigger logic unit) channel. Range : [0 to 3].
Set whether status flag has to be cleared by software or hardware. Refer XMC_ERU_ETL_STATUS_FLAG_MODE_t for valid value.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Set the mode for status flag mode by setting (LD) bit in EXICONx(x = channel) register.

If SWCTRL is selected, status flag has to be cleared by software. This is typically used for pattern match detection. If HWCTRL is selected, status flag is cleared by hardware. If Positive edge is selected as event edge, for negative edge status flag is cleared and vice versa.This is typically used for continuous event detection.These values are set during initialization in XMC_ERU_ETL_Init(). Call this to change the trigger edge, as needed later in the program.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_ERU_ETL_ClearStatusFlag(), XMC_ERU_ETL_GetStatusFlag()

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_OGU_DisablePatternDetection

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address
ERU_OGUy(Output gating unit) channel Range : [0 to 3]

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Disable the pattern detection by clearing (GEEN) bit.
Typically XMC_ERU_OGU_DisablePatternDetection is used when events has to be generated peripheral triggers.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_ERU_OGU_EnablePatternDetection(), XMC_ERU_OGU_GetPatternDetectionStatus()

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_OGU_DisablePeripheralTrigger

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address
ERU_OGUy(Output gating unit) channel Range : [0 to 3]

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Disables event generation based on peripheral trigger by clearing (ISS) bit.

This is typically used when peripheral trigger is no longer need. After calling XMC_ERU_OGU_DisablePeripheralTrigger(), XMC_ERU_OGU_EnablePeripheralTrigger() has to be called to reconfigure the signals again.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel, const XMC_ERU_OGU_PATTERN_DETECTION_INPUT_t input)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_OGU_EnablePatternDetection

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address
ERU_OGUy(Output gating unit) channel Range : [0 to 3]
ERU_ETLx(x = [0 to 3]), for pattern match detection. Refer XMC_ERU_OGU_PATTERN_DETECTION_INPUT_t for valid values. Logical OR combination of the enum items can be passed as the input.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures ERU_ETLx(x = [0 to 3]) for pattern match detection by setting IPENx(x = [0 to 3]) and GEEN bits.

These bits are dedicated to each channel of the ERU_ETLx(x = [0 to 3]). These values are set during initialization in XMC_ERU_OGU_Init(). Call this to change the pattern, as needed later in the program.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_ERU_OGU_DisablePatternDetection(), XMC_ERU_OGU_GetPatternDetectionStatus()

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel, const XMC_ERU_OGU_PERIPHERAL_TRIGGER_t peripheral_trigger)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_OGU_EnablePeripheralTrigger

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address
ERU_OGUy(Output gating unit) channel Range : [0 to 3]

which peripheral trigger signal is used for event generation. Refer XMC_ERU_OGU_PERIPHERAL_TRIGGER_t for the valid values, or xmc1_eru_map.h/xmc4_eru_map.h file where the mapping of the peripheral input is done based on input. e.g: ERU0_OGU0_PERIPHERAL_TRIGGER_CCU40_SR0.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures peripheral trigger input, by setting (ISS) bit.
Based on the peripheral the input signal has to be selected. These values are set during initialization in XMC_ERU_OGU_Init(). Call this to change the input, as needed later in the program.

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_OGU_GetPatternDetectionStatus

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address
ERU_OGUy(Output gating unit) channel Range : [0 to 3]

simplesect.para: uint32_t returns the pattern match result. Result is in 32-bit format.

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: This API returns the pattern match result by reading (PDR) bit.

simplesect.title: Related APIs:
simplesect.para: XMC_ERU_OGU_EnablePatternDetection(), XMC_ERU_OGU_DisablePatternDetection()

eru

memberdef.argsstring: (XMC_ERU_t *const eru, const uint8_t channel, const XMC_ERU_OGU_SERVICE_REQUEST_t mode)
memberdef.name: XMC_ERU_OGU_SetServiceRequestMode

parameterdescription.para: A constant pointer to XMC_ERU_t, pointing to the ERU base address
ERU_OGUy(Output gating unit) channel Range : [0 to 3]
gating scheme for service request generation. Refer XMC_ERU_OGU_SERVICE_REQUEST_t for valid values.

simplesect.para: None

simplesect.title: Description:
simplesect.para: Configures the gating scheme for service request generation by setting (GP) bit.

Typically this function is used to change the service request generation scheme. These values are set during initialization in XMC_ERU_OGU_Init(). Call this to change the gating mode, as needed later in the program.

briefdescription.para: Event Request Unit (ERU) driver for the XMC microcontroller family.

detaileddescription.para: The Event Request Unit (ERU) is a versatile multiple input event detection and processing unit. The ERU module can be used to expand the P-to-P connections of the device: ports-to-peripherals, peripherals-to-peripherals and ports-to-ports. It also offers configurable logic, that allows the generation of triggers, pattern detection and real-time signal monitoring.

The driver is divided into two sections: Event trigger logic (ERU_ETL):
This section of the LLD provides the configuration structure XMC_ERU_ETL_CONFIG_t and the initialization function XMC_ERU_ETL_Init(). It can be used to:
Select one out of two inputs (A and B). For each of these two inputs, a vector of 4 possible signals is available. (XMC_ERU_ETL_SetSource())
Logically combine the two input signals to a common trigger. (XMC_ERU_ETL_SetSource())
Define the transition (edge selection, or by software) that leads to a trigger event and can also store this status. (XMC_ERU_ETL_SetEdgeDetection() and XMC_ERU_ETL_SetStatusFlag())
Distribute the events and status flags to the output channels. (XMC_ERU_ETL_EnableOutputTrigger())
Output gating unit (ERU_OGU):
This section of the LLD provides the provides the configuration structure XMC_ERU_OGU_CONFIG_t and the initialization function XMC_ERU_ETL_OGU_Init(). It can be used to:
Combine the trigger events and status information and gates the output depending on a gating signal. (XMC_ERU_OGU_EnablePatternDetection(), XMC_ERU_OGU_DisablePeripheralTrigger(), XMC_ERU_OGU_SetServiceRequestMode())
